comment: Professor Gutierrez was a mediocre instructor. If his ego had not played such a large role in the course, I would have enjoyed the material and experience in his class more. He doesn't show up to his own office hours so make sure you schedule and confirm a meeting with him before he leaves you waiting for 30+ minutes. Easy grader tho!!

The most amazing and caring professor. Class consists of making video and audio, but he is always there to help. SUCH an easy grader… He just wants you to learn and be better than the last time!! Its a safe zone to create and mistakes are welcome. TAKE HIM!!!

Professor is one of the best mentors and instructors I have ever had in my college career at Kennesaw. He has changed my outlook not just on film and storytelling but also on life. You will not only want to learn more about film, but how to love it, master it, and hone it for yourself and your career. I am priviledged to call him my friend.

The class I took is not listed it's 4495 - MENT Study Bus Tour. I think all MENT students MUST take this  if you want to know whether a career in film and television is right for you and it's perhaps the most important college class I ever took. It's only 2 weeks but you'll see pros from the industry come and talk and then you'll visit the studios.

Professor Gutierrez is a must-take in the MENT department at KSU. Great advice and very friendly. You can tell he has been doing film for a long time and is truly passionate about teaching. Get ready to get out of your comfort zone for the Documentary class, but it is well worth the effort.

Absolutely loved this class! Professor Gutierrez is one of the most involved and inspiring professors I have taken at KSU. He knows what he is talking about as he is in the media industry as well. Additionally, Professor Gutierrez would take the time to find jobs and present them to the class. He truly wants everyone he teaches to succeed.

Professor Bobby is a great professor to take. He doesn't teach in a classroom setting. Everything you learn, you'll be able to use in the real world. He cares for his students. He wants you to create work that you can put in your portfolio. Utilize his office hours to discuss projects because he will break it down everything you should change.
Great professor! Would recommend him. Teaches you how it would be in the real world and gives you many opportunities to internships and jobs.

Does very little teaching but does a lot of speaking about how good he is at setting up students for networking, so if you want to network but not actually learn anything you'll probably be fine. Also beware because he gives you no feedback (not even some bullet points) on any work you turn in unless you schedule an appointment in  person.
He is very passionate about film and will go out of his way to help you out. He is now my mentor in this film/career journey.

I had to take this class for my major, I informed him that I have zero experience with audio/video. He wouldn't work to meet with me outside of class before/after class, he would only meet me on days I had to go to my job. He grades harshly and when u turn something in he will play it in front of everyone and critique it. I recommend Russell James
Professor G is amazing. He is very understanding, has so many connections, and truly strives to help you reach your full potential. If you are considering taking someone else, you're wrong.

I have taken professor G for three courses now and he is one of the best professors I've had so far. He really cares for his students and where you want to go after graduation. His courses aren't just about the material but also about finding what really interests you in this industry. If you have the chance to take one of his classes don't miss it
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Definitely take Professor G if you get the chance. He is a very connected guy and cares so much about each of his students. It is so clear that he puts his heart into everything he does and will help you out in any way he can. His classes are designed to benefit you and your future. One of the best professors I have taken at KSU!

Prof G wants you to create content you can add to your portfolio. He understands what is submitted for your assignment is not the best possible take and he will meet with you outside of class to get it portfolio ready. Fun class with lots of creative freedom. Would take one of his classes again!

I have mixed feelings about Prof G. He's really passionate about entertainment and the work you will produce but isn't a great professor. He says the same thing in every class and says to reach out to him but does not reply to emails/texts and takes nearly the entire semester to give any grades or feedback. Only take if you can work independently

I've taken Professor G for two classes. I really enjoyed him for digital production. It was a short class (due to Covid) but he gave lots of information and guidance. The documentary class felt more redundant because he lectured about similar topics he did in digital production. He's a great teacher for people new to film but he does lecture heavy.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: I wish he gave more feedback and guidance on his projects. It was okay. He responses very slow to his emails .

TAKE HIM! He has many connections to the entertainment business and he knows what he is talking about. He inspires you to do your best and grades you upon how much effort you put into something, not how good it looks. If you reach out to him and keep in touch, he is a great person to know. Project based class, try and you will succeed

Prof. G is a MUST-TAKE professor. He is incredibly focused on teaching real and applicable situations in the industry, not from a book. He genuinely cares about every single student. With many connections in entertainment, he always searches for opportunities for students to gain real experience. If you apply yourself, Prof G will help you succeed!

This was my second time taking Prof. G he is awesome both in class and online. He is not your normal teacher. He is business minded and has a ton of experience in the film industry. I look up to him. By far my favorite professor at KSU. His assignments are easy to understand and fun to do. Take him, you won't regret it.

Professor was pretty easy but a stifler for grades! Just make sure you submit everything on time, pay attention, and you should be just fine. He does take role every class so if you skip you will not pass! Never stayed the entire class period after he finished his lesson, and gives great feedback. 3 small quizzes and 4 big projects, SUBMIT ON TIME!

I've taken Professor G a couple of times and it is one of my favorite teachers. He is really hands on, offers opportunities outside of class in the material that you are learning, and he is very welcoming whenever you feel lost or have a question. I recommend him if you are looking to get into production.

I put MENT 4444, but out of the three different courses I had with Professor G, they're all pretty much the same. I can honestly say that he is by far the best professor that I have had at KSU. I never understood the criticism that he receives. He offers great advice and plenty of opportunities for students to reach out to him. You won't regret it!

I took 3 classes taught by Professor G and look back at them as some of the most beneficial classes that I took at KSU. He is an awesome educator who is very passionate and knowledgeable about what he teaches. If you want to build a media portfolio while in school, take his classes. He took time outside of class many times to help me with projects.

Professor G is a great teacher and he helps you to understand everything you need to make sure you succeed on your projects/assignments. The class projects were a lot of fun, and the overall class helps you to learn how to make a meaningful documentary.

I had professor Gutierrez for summer semester and while he is a little disorganized (didn't upload the syllabus until after 2 weeks), he's super fun. He gives great feedback on all projects and always answers emails on time. As a bonus, he's worked in the film industry so he understands the subject material super well. Overall, I'm glad I had him.

This class is an easy A, but you dont learn much in the class. We were supposed to learn a lot about adobe but he skimmed over all of the programs too fast and expected us to know how to use them. He took forever to grade work, but he was an easy grader. Dont buy the book, its not worth it. Take this class with another professor if you can.

I'm not sure what everyone else's problem with him is, but I actually liked his class! To be fair, he is super unorganized, you go to class just to hear him talk for 75 minutes and he takes forever to grade. Otherwise, the work isn't hard, he is always willing to meet and he's passionate about the topic.
AVOID TAKING THIS PROFESSOR.

Prof Gutierrez class is one of the worst classes I've ever taken. He has an impressive resume but he does not teach well. He did not follow his own class schedule. Because of this, we had a very short time to do major projects. Know Adobe or you will be behind, he does not teach it thoroughly. DO NOT TAKE HIM. (His MENT4444 is the exact same class)
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS
